def_cn: （英国为防止市议会随意提高地方税率，促其削减开支或提高效率而）限定…的地方税额
def_en: In Britain, when a local council was rate-capped, the government prevented it from increasing local taxes called rates, in order to force the council to reduce its spending or make it more efficient.
A rate cap is a limit placed by the government on the amount of interest that banks or credit card companies can charge their customers.
